title: Integrate UDS Document Standards into MCP Servers
description: Enhance coderef-docs MCP server to use Universal Documentation Standards (UDS) header/footer templates with workorder and MCP attribution for all generated documentation

context.motivation: Unify documentation generation across all MCP servers with consistent headers/footers that track workorders, feature IDs, and generating MCP server. Improve traceability and compliance with UDS standards.
context.problem_statement:
Currently, generated documentation lacks:
- Workorder/feature ID linkage
- MCP server attribution (which server generated it?)
- Change history tracking
- Consistent version tracking across ecosystem
- Integration with orchestrator tracking system
requirements: Import UDS standard-document-header-template.md and standard-document-footer-template.md into coderef-docs
Enhance header template with: generated_by (MCP server name), workorder_id, feature_id, timestamp
Enhance footer template with: generated_by version, workorder reference, next review date
Update coderef-docs tools to automatically inject headers/footers into generated content
Update coderef-workflow to use enhanced headers in generated plans
Add metadata context to all documentation generation calls
Create validation schema for header/footer compliance
Document standards usage in coderef-docs README

phase_1_setup: Add metadata injection to doc generation pipeline
phase_2_integration: Update README.md generation to use headers
phase_3_workflow: Add workorder_id to all plan documents
Track plan versions in header version field
phase_4_validation: Audit existing generated docs for compliance

data_flow: Orchestrator passes workorder_id + feature_id to MCP server
MCP server retrieves metadata (version, status, author)
Generated doc includes full traceability chain
Footer includes next_review_date based on status
success_criteria: All generated docs have valid headers with workorder_id + generated_by
All generated docs have valid footers with MCP attribution
Docs can be traced back to originating workorder via stub.json
Validation linter passes 100% of generated docs
Documentation traceability chain is unbroken (orchestrator → workorder → feature → doc)
